Barang Unik yang Dilelang Mahal, Ada Celana Dalam Elvis Presley
04 Nov 2019, 10:40 by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Mitra Tarigan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Siapa selebriti favorit Anda? Apakah Elvis Presley, Justin Bieber, atau Justin Timberlake? Biasanya, para penggemar akan melakukan apapun untuk bisa bertemu dengan idola pujaannya. Jika ada barang yang menarik dari selebriti tersebut, fans garis keras bahkan rela mengikuti lelang dengan harga fantastis guna mendapatkannya.
Tahu apa saja barang-barang unik yang pernah dilelang dengan harga tinggi itu? Berikut adalah beberapa diantaranya seperti yang dilansir dari situs People.com dan The Wrap.
1. Rambut Justin BieberBarang lelang pertama yang menarik perhatian adalah rambut Justin Bieber. Tepatnya pada tahun 2011 silam, potongan rambut pelantun lagu Love Yourself itu terjual dengan harga lebih dari 40 ribu dolar Amerika Serikat (setara dengan 560 juta rupiah). Kabarnya, hasil lelang tersebut digunakan untuk organisasi hak-hak hewan yang berbasis di California Gentle Barn Foundation.
2. Pakaian dalam Elvis PresleyBarang lelang dari raja rock n roll, Elvis Presley juga sangat menarik perhatian. Barang itu adalah celana dalam dengan noda. Ia diketahui sering menggunakan celana dalam itu dengan jumpsuits putih ikoniknya. Tak disangka, lelang yang dilakukan pada tahun 2012 silam itu terjual dengan harga 8 ribu dolar Amerika Serikat (setara dengan 112 juta rupiah).
3. Roti Bakar Bekas Justin Timberlake Saat masih tergabung dalam grup band N Sync, Justin Timberlake sempat membeli makanan berupa roti bakar. Karena tidak jadi dimakan, pihak hotel yang melihat makanan itu pun melelangnya. Ternyata, sepotong roti bakar bekas Justin Timberlake itu dihargai seharga 1.025 dolar Amerika Serikat (setara dengan 12,5 juta rupiah).
4. Tisu Scarlett JohanssonSaat menjadi seorang narasumber di acara The Tonight Show pada tahun 2008 silam, aktris Scarlett Johansson sempat menggunakan sehelai tisu. Tak disangka, tisu bekas yang dijual di platform eBay itu terjual dengan harga 5.300 dolar Amerika Serikat (setara dengan 74 juta rupiah).
Kira-kira apakah Anda berani membeli barang barang sisa artis itu?

SARAH ERVINA DARA SIYAHAILATUA | PEOPLE.COM | THEWRAP

Unique Items Auction Expensive, There are Elvis Presley's Underwears
04 Nov 2019, 10:40 by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Mitra Tarigan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Who is your favorite celebrity? Is it Elvis Presley, Justin Bieber, or Justin Timberlake? Usually, fans will do everything they can to meet their idol idols. If there is an interesting item from the celebrity, hard-line fans are even willing to enter the auction at fantastic prices to get it.
Do you know what unique items that have been auctioned at such high prices? Here are some of them as reported by the People.com site and The Wrap.
1. Justin Bieber's Hair The first auction item that caught attention was Justin Bieber's hair. Precisely in 2011 ago, the haircut chanting the song Love Yourself was sold at a price of more than 40 thousand US dollars (equivalent to 560 million rupiah). Reportedly, the results of the auction were used for animal rights organizations based in California Gentle Barn Foundation.
2. Elvis Presley's underwear The auction item from the king of rock n roll, Elvis Presley is also very interesting. The item is underwear with stains. He is known to often use the underwear with his iconic white jumpsuits. Not unexpectedly, the auction conducted in 2012 was sold for 8 thousand US dollars (equivalent to 112 million rupiah).
3. Justin Timberlake Former Toast When still joined in the band N Sync, Justin Timberlake had time to buy food in the form of toast. Because it did not get eaten, the hotel who saw the food auctioned it. It turns out, a piece of toast used by Justin Timberlake was valued at US $ 1,025 (equivalent to 12.5 million rupiah).
4. Scarlett Johansson Wipes When she was a guest speaker at The Tonight Show in 2008, actress Scarlett Johansson had used a tissue. Not unexpectedly, used tissue sold on the eBay platform was sold at 5,300 US dollars (equivalent to 74 million rupiah).
Do you think you dare to buy the rest of the artist's items?

SARAH ERVINA DARA SIYAHAILATUA | PEOPLE.COM | THEWRAP
